intro: Senecio boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian groundsels, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and serrated, while the flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Senecio boliviensis is often found in high-altitude areas, where it contributes to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
